dict.string:
Lets you get interactions on Layer patches, or the whole screen if the interaction port isn't connected.
Down: Outputs a 1 if the touch is currently down on the layer. Useful for pressed states. Up: Sends a pulse when the layer is pressed and released. Useful for button actions. Tap: Sends a pulse when the layer is tapped while the touch is stationary. Useful for getting taps on a scrollable layer. Drag: Outputs a 1 if the touch started down on the layer and stays 1 until the touch is released. Enable: Lets you decide whether the layer should respond to interaction. One example of when you'd want to use this is if you had a shading layer in front of an interactive element. You'd need to disable interaction on the shading layer so you could get taps on the layer behind it.
Origami http://origami.facebook.com/

Enable interaction for this layer. Turn this off to have taps pass through the layer.
Sends a pulse when the layer is pressed and released. Useful for button actions.
Outputs a 1 if the touch started down on the layer and stays 1 until the touch is released.
Outputs a 1 if the touch is currently down on the layer. Useful for pressed states.
Sends a pulse when the layer is tapped while the touch is stationary. Useful for getting taps on a scrollable layer.
